from pyspark import SparkContext
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession, Row
# Create SparkContext
#sc = SparkContext("local", "CSV to RDD")

# Read CSV file into RDD
rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")
data_rdd = rdd.collect()
print(data_rdd)
char = '"'
index = 0

new_data = []
for i in data_rdd:
    noo = i.split(',')
    if char in noo[index][1:-1]:
        modified_string = noo[index][:1] + noo[index][1:-1].replace(char, '') + noo[index][-1]
        noo[index] = modified_string
        n_str = ','.join(noo)
        new_data.append(n_str)
    else:
        n_str = ','.join(noo)
        new_data.append(n_str)

print(new_data)

from pyspark.sql.types import *
def is_digit(s):
    return s.isdigit()
def remove_char(columnName, charName):
    
    schema = StructType([
        StructField('name', StringType(), True),
        StructField('school', StringType(), True),
        StructField('fees', IntegerType(), True),
        StructField('age', IntegerType(), True),
        StructField('place', StringType(), True)
    ])
    rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")
    neww = rdd.first()
    index = neww.index(columnName)
    data_rdd = rdd.collect()
    new_data = []
    for i in data_rdd:
        noo = i.split(',')
        if char in noo[index][1:-1]:
            modified_string = noo[index][:1] + noo[index][1:-1].replace(char, '') + noo[index][-1]
            noo[index] = modified_string
            n_str = ','.join(noo)
            new_data.append(n_str)
        else:
            n_str = ','.join(noo)
            new_data.append(n_str)

    header = new_data[0]
    data = new_data[1:]

    # Split each line by comma and create Row objects
    split_data = [line.split(',') for line in data]
    rows = [Row(*line) for line in split_data]

    # Create DataFrame with inferred schema
    df = spark.createDataFrame(rows, header.split(','))
    df = df.withColumn('fees',df.fees.cast('int')).withColumn('age',df.age.cast('int'))
    df.printSchema()
    df.show()



remove_char('name','"')

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, when, regexp_extract
from pyspark.sql.types import StringType, IntegerType
def is_digit(s):
    return s.isdigit()
df_cast = df.select(
    col("Name"),
    when(col("Age").rlike("^[0-9]+$"), col("Age").cast(IntegerType())).otherwise(col("Age")).alias("Age")

from pyspark import SparkContext

# Initialize SparkContext
#sc = SparkContext("local", "SplitRecordsExample")

# Example RDD with comma-separated records
original_rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")

# Function to split each record by comma
def split_record(record):
    return record.split(',')

# Apply the split_record function to each record using map()
split_rdd = original_rdd.map(split_record)

# Collect and print the transformed RDD
collected_data = split_rdd.collect()
for record in collected_data:
    print(record)
split_rdd.collect()

#def replace_quotes_in_list(sublist):
    #return [string.replace('"', '') for string in sublist]

char = '"'

def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
    modified_list = []
    for string in strings_list:
        if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
            modified_string = (
                string[:1] +
                string[1:-1].replace('"', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                string[-1:]
            )
            modified_list.append(modified_string)
        else:
            modified_list.append(string)
    return modified_list

# Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
modified_rdd.collect()

header = modified_rdd.first()

# Filter out the header row from the RDD
data_without_header = modified_rdd.filter(lambda row: row != header)
data_without_header.collect()

# Convert RDD to DataFrame with headers
df = spark.createDataFrame(data_without_header,header)
df.show()
df.show()
df.printSchema()

def csvtodf(char):
    from pyspark import SparkContext


    # Initialize SparkContext
    #sc = SparkContext("local", "SplitRecordsExample")

    # Example RDD with comma-separated records
    original_rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")

    # Function to split each record by comma
    def split_record(record):
        return record.split(',')

    # Apply the split_record function to each record using map()
    split_rdd = original_rdd.map(split_record)

    # Collect and print the transformed RDD
    #collected_data = split_rdd.collect()
    #for record in collected_data:
        #print(record)

    if char == '"':
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('"', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()

    elif char == '/':
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('/', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
    elif char == '/"':
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('/"', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
    header = modified_rdd.first()

    # Filter out the header row from the RDD
    data_without_header = modified_rdd.filter(lambda row: row != header)
    data_without_header.collect()

    # Convert RDD to DataFrame with headers
    df = spark.createDataFrame(data_without_header,header)
    df.show()

csvtodf('/"')

original_rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")
new_rdd = original_rdd
new_rdd.collect()

def csvtodf(char):
    from pyspark import SparkContext


    # Initialize SparkContext
    #sc = SparkContext("local", "SplitRecordsExample")

    # Example RDD with comma-separated records
    original_rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")

    # Function to split each record by comma
    def split_record(record):
        return record.split(',')

    # Apply the split_record function to each record using map()
    split_rdd = original_rdd.map(split_record)

    # Collect and print the transformed RDD
    #collected_data = split_rdd.collect()
    #for record in collected_data:
        #print(record)

    match char:
        case '"':
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('"', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()

        case "'":
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace("'", '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
        case "#":
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('#', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
    header = modified_rdd.first()

    # Filter out the header row from the RDD
    data_without_header = modified_rdd.filter(lambda row: row != header)
    data_without_header.collect()

    # Convert RDD to DataFrame with headers
    df = spark.createDataFrame(data_without_header,header)
    df.show()

csvtodf('"')

    # Initialize SparkContext
    #sc = SparkContext("local", "SplitRecordsExample")

    original_rdd = sc.textFile("abfss://csvfile@myadls5434.blob.core.windows.net/csv_issue.csv")

    def split_record(record):
        return record.split(',')

    # Apply the split_record function to each record using map()

    # Collect and print the transformed RDD

    #for record in collected_data:
        #print(record)

    match char:
        case '"':
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('"', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()

        case "'":
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace("'", '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last
                            string[-1:]
                        )
                        modified_list.append(modified_string)
                    else:
                        modified_list.append(string)
                return modified_list

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
        case "#":
            def replace_quotes_in_list(strings_list):
                modified_list = []
                for string in strings_list:
                    if len(string) > 2:  # Ensure the string has more than 2 characters
                        modified_string = (
                            string[:1] +
                            string[1:-1].replace('#', '') +  # Replace quotes between indices 1 and second-to-last

                        modified_list.append(string)

            # Apply the function using map() to replace quotes in each string in the list
            modified_rdd = split_rdd.map(replace_quotes_in_list)
            #modified_rdd.collect()
    header = modified_rdd.first()

    # Filter out the header row from the RDD
    data_without_header = modified_rdd.filter(lambda row: row != header)
    data_without_header.collect()

    # Convert RDD to DataFrame with headers
    df = spark.createDataFrame(data_without_header,header)
    df.show()
